item.title: Continuum Protocols
item.description: This document defines the core protocols behind Continuumâ€™s archive-backed approach to Nostr identity, publishing, and messaging. It formalizes a simple but non-standard assumption: relays are caches, not memory. By treating archives as the source of truth and manifests as authoritative intent, Continuum enables deterministic reconstruction of profiles, notes, encrypted DMs, and long-form articlesâ€”even if relays forget, backups reappear, or local databases are wiped. The protocols described here prioritize durability, deletion intent, encrypted message continuity, and long-horizon identity over feeds, engagement, or client features.

item.title: Patron Support Continuum
item.description: A personal invitation to support the ongoing development of Continuum â€” a sovereign publishing platform, multi-identity Nostr client, and creative engine behind the Bitcoin Chronicles. Patron support helps keep the work independent, aligned with first principles, and free from corporate or institutional control.

item.title: Continuum Pro â€” Sovereign Publishing, Permanently Archived Under Continuum Stewardship
item.description: Continuum Pro is a managed, sovereign archival service for Nostr long-form (kind:30023) events. It creates a permanent, relay-independent archive under nostr.mycontinuum.xyz, with year-based directories per npub, a static HTML viewer, a global index, and full access to all paid articles, plus the local Continuum app for unlimited identity management.

item.title: Sovereign Support vs. Donor Dependency
item.description: Contrasts donor-based giving (dependency, fragility) with sovereignty-based support (reciprocity, resilience), showing why future-facing work must be funded through value exchange, not entitlement.

item.title: White Paper: Sovereign Storage
item.description: Sovereign Storage redefines data ownership by replacing custodial, account-based storage with cryptographically secured, self-sovereign identity. It enables individuals and organizations to store, control, and share their data without reliance on centralized platformsâ€”just as Bitcoin liberated money, Sovereign Storage liberates data.

item.title: A Declaration of Digital Independence
item.description: Published on July 4 as a declaration of digital independence, this inaugural post from the Continuum identity was written, signed, and published using a fully self-hosted system. It introduces Continuum not just as a tool, but as a sovereign philosophy â€” rejecting platforms, reclaiming identity, and proving that we can publish from our own machines, without permission.
